pr_title: [WFLY-13085] Add documentation on the TLS 1.3 support for the OpenSSL TLS provider

timeline.bodyText: Just curious - I guess this will need some change into wildfly/wildfly-core code/configuration, right?
timeline.author: jstourac
timeline.diffHunk:
@@ -38,4 +38,19 @@ If OpenSSL was loaded successfully, a message similar to the one below will occu
 [source,options="nowrap"]
 ----
 15:37:59,814 INFO [org.wildfly.openssl.SSL] (MSC service thread 1-7) WFOPENSSL0002 OpenSSL Version OpenSSL 1.1.1d FIPS  10 Sep 2019
-----
\ No newline at end of file
+----
+
+=== TLSv1.3
+
+TLSv1.3 will be enabled by default when using OpenSSL 1.1.1 or higher and when running against JDK 11 or higher.
+OpenSSL will use the following TLSv1.3 cipher suites by default:
+
+[source,options="nowrap"]
+----
+TLS_AES_256_GCM_SHA384:TLS_CHACHA20_POLY1305_SHA256:TLS_AES_128_GCM_SHA256

replies.bodyText: No additional changes will be needed for this. Support for the cipher-suite-names attribute for SSL contexts was already added as part of WFCORE-4172.
replies.author: fjuma

timeline.bodyText: When I generate this docs, the links don't seem to work - the Using_the_Elytron_Subsystem.html does not exist on my side. Is this expected at this moment or am I doing something wrong?

replies.bodyText: When viewing this file from GitHub, the link does work correctly. I haven't tried generating the docs locally though. What is the command you are using to do that?
replies.author: fjuma

replies.bodyText:
You are right, GitHub preview works just fine. It's just HTML output that seems broken. I used following steps:
cd doc
mvn clean install

and looked on the html results in Firefox - when you naviage to the link in question, then the target link is not valid as it contains wrong filename, e.g.:
Using_the_Elytron_Subsystem.html#configuring-a-server-sslcontext

instead of:
WildFly_Elytron_Security.html#configuring-a-server-sslcontext

Maybe I just generate the doc in the wrong way.
replies.author: jstourac

replies.bodyText: You're right, I just tried generating the docs and ran into the same issue. I've fixed it now. Thanks!
replies.author: fjuma
